messages.msgSnippet: Thank you!  It s perfect; I knew it had to exist, but Googling just kept sending me off to on-line gambling, no mater how much I excluded.  I thank you and my
messages.messageBody:
Thank you! It's perfect; I knew it had to exist, but Googling
just kept sending me off to on-line gambling, no mater how much
I excluded. I thank you and my daughter thanks you!

This site has a Bingo card generator: http://teachers.teach-nology.com/web_tools/materials/bingo/

Betsy
(going back to my grace period of lurking and learning!)
----- Original Message -----
From: Nora or Devereaux Cannon
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, April 25, 2004 9:05 AM
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Party Game


Our 7 y.o. is planning a party (that actually is true of her
most of the time, LOL). She has in mind a game that is
essentially Bingo, but with words she has chosen rather than
numbers or pre-themed "educational" mess. I think part of her
plan is to let the person who Bingo's first do some sort of
Madlib activity for an extra prize.

My problem comes in with generating the cards. I was sure that
I would find a Bingo card generator on-line somewhere, but no
luck yet. I could hand write/table type the 40 cards that I
suspect this venture requires for maximum fun.

However, if you have in your bag of tricks an on-line Bingo card
generator, I would be very grateful for the link.



"List Posting Policies" are provided in the files area of this group.

messages.msgSnippet: Our 7 y.o. is planning a party (that actually is true of her most of the time, LOL).  She has in mind a game that is essentially Bingo, but with words she has
messages.messageBody:
Our 7 y.o. is planning a party (that actually is true of her
most of the time, LOL). She has in mind a game that is
essentially Bingo, but with words she has chosen rather than
numbers or pre-themed "educational" mess. I think part of her
plan is to let the person who Bingo's first do some sort of
Madlib activity for an extra prize.

My problem comes in with generating the cards. I was sure that
I would find a Bingo card generator on-line somewhere, but no
luck yet. I could hand write/table type the 40 cards that I
suspect this venture requires for maximum fun.

However, if you have in your bag of tricks an on-line Bingo card
generator, I would be very grateful for the link.
